column4: i had to compile alsa 1.0.9 for my sound to work..... if i update the linux-headers and image will that break my sound?
if it overwrites the .ko for your driver, yes
can i stop that from happening
back it up, restore it after installing the kernel image
good idea thanks man
presumably 150MB of that is disk cache

install the -686 kernel
is that easy
is it an option at the normal install
yes, if you have a 686 cpu
no
Debian (which I still do use)
